text.p: The United Arab Emirates has asked to buy 72 RIM-7M Seasparrow missiles and 24 RGM-84G-4 Harpoon missiles from the U.S., according to the Defense Department.
The Seasparrow missiles are estimated to cost $27 million and the Harpoon missiles $90 million, the Pentagon said earlier this week.
The prime contractor for the Seasparrow missiles would be Raytheon Co. of Lowell, Mass., and the prime contractor for the Harpoon missiles would be McDonnell Douglas of St. Louis, Missouri.
Information about the possible missile sales was available on the Defense Department's Internet website at http://www.dtic./mil/defenselink.

The Washington Times newspaper reported on Monday that the UAE told the Pentagon "unofficially" last week that it planned to buy U.S. F-16s, made by Lockheed-Martin Corp., rather than European jet fighters.
A Washington-based military expert told Reuters earlier in the week that there were "serious negotiation going on" between the UAE and Washington over buying American fighter jets.
